00068 struct ast_module_user {
00069    struct ast_channel *chan;
00070    AST_LIST_ENTRY(ast_module_user) entry;
00071 };

00073 AST_LIST_HEAD(module_user_list, ast_module_user);

00075 static unsigned char expected_key[] =
00076 { 0x87, 0x76, 0x79, 0x35, 0x23, 0xea, 0x3a, 0xd3,
00077   0x25, 0x2a, 0xbb, 0x35, 0x87, 0xe4, 0x22, 0x24 };

00079 static unsigned int embedding = 1; /* we always start out by registering embedded modules,
00080                   since they are here before we dlopen() any
00081                */
00082 
00083 struct ast_module {
00084    const struct ast_module_info *info;
00085    void *lib;              /* the shared lib, or NULL if embedded */
00086    int usecount;              /* the number of 'users' currently in this module */
00087    struct module_user_list users;         /* the list of users in the module */
00088    struct {
00089       unsigned int running:1;
00090       unsigned int declined:1;
00091    } flags;
00092    AST_LIST_ENTRY(ast_module) entry;
00093    char resource[0];
00094 };
00095 
00096 static AST_LIST_HEAD_STATIC(module_list, ast_module);

00099    int (*updater)(void);
00100    AST_LIST_ENTRY(loadupdate) entry;
00101 };

00107 /* when dynamic modules are being loaded, ast_module_register() will
00108    need to know what filename the module was loaded from while it
00109    is being registered
00110 */
00111 struct ast_module *resource_being_loaded;
00112 
00113 /* XXX: should we check for duplicate resource names here? */
00114 
00115 void ast_module_register(const struct ast_module_info *info)
00116 {
00117    struct ast_module *mod;
00118 
00119    if (embedding) {
00120       if (!(mod = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*mod) + strlen(info->name) + 1)))
00121          return;
00122       strcpy(mod->resource, info->name);
00123    } else {
00124       mod = resource_being_loaded;
00125    }
00126 
00127    mod->info = info;
00128    AST_LIST_HEAD_INIT(&mod->users);
00129 
00130    /* during startup, before the loader has been initialized,
00131       there are no threads, so there is no need to take the lock
00132       on this list to manipulate it. it is also possible that it
00133       might be unsafe to use the list lock at that point... so
00134       let's avoid it altogether
00135    */
00136    if (!embedding)
00137       AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00138 
00139    /* it is paramount that the new entry be placed at the tail of
00140       the list, otherwise the code that uses dlopen() to load
00141       dynamic modules won't be able to find out if the module it
00142       just opened was registered or failed to load
00143    */
00144    AST_LIST_INSERT_TAIL(&module_list, mod, entry);
00145 
00146    if (!embedding)
00147       AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00148 
00149    /* give the module a copy of its own handle, for later use in registrations and the like */
00150    *((struct ast_module **) &(info->self)) = mod;
00151 }
00152 
00153 void ast_module_unregister(const struct ast_module_info *info)
00154 {
00155    struct ast_module *mod = NULL;
00156 
00157    /* it is assumed that the users list in the module structure
00158       will already be empty, or we cannot have gotten to this
00159       point
00160    */
00161    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00162    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&module_list, mod, entry) {
00163       if (mod->info == info) {
00164          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&module_list, entry);
00165          break;
00166       }
00167    }
00168    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00169    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00170 
00171    if (mod) {
00172       AST_LIST_HEAD_DESTROY(&mod->users);
00173       free(mod);
00174    }
00175 }
00176 
00177 struct ast_module_user *__ast_module_user_add(struct ast_module *mod,
00178                      struct ast_channel *chan)
00179 {
00180    struct ast_module_user *u = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*u));
00181 
00182    if (!u)
00183       return NULL;
00184 
00185    u->chan = chan;
00186 
00187    AST_LIST_LOCK(&mod->users);
00188    AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&mod->users, u, entry);
00189    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&mod->users);
00190 
00191    ast_atomic_fetchadd_int(&mod->usecount, +1);
00192 
00193    ast_update_use_count();
00194 
00195    return u;
00196 }
00197 
00198 void __ast_module_user_remove(struct ast_module *mod, struct ast_module_user *u)
00199 {
00200    AST_LIST_LOCK(&mod->users);
00201    AST_LIST_REMOVE(&mod->users, u, entry);
00202    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&mod->users);
00203    ast_atomic_fetchadd_int(&mod->usecount, -1);
00204    free(u);
00205 
00206    ast_update_use_count();
00207 }
00208 
00209 void __ast_module_user_hangup_all(struct ast_module *mod)
00210 {
00211    struct ast_module_user *u;
00212 
00213    AST_LIST_LOCK(&mod->users);
00214    while ((u = AST_LIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&mod->users, entry))) {
00215       ast_softhangup(u->chan, AST_SOFTHANGUP_APPUNLOAD);
00216       ast_atomic_fetchadd_int(&mod->usecount, -1);
00217       free(u);
00218    }
00219    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&mod->users);
00220 
00221         ast_update_use_count();
00222 }

00224 /*! \note
00225  * In addition to modules, the reload command handles some extra keywords
00226  * which are listed here together with the corresponding handlers.
00227  * This table is also used by the command completion code.
00228  */
00229 static struct reload_classes {
00230    const char *name;
00231    int (*reload_fn)(void);
00232 } reload_classes[] = {  /* list in alpha order, longest match first for cli completion */
00233    { "cdr", ast_cdr_engine_reload },
00234    { "dnsmgr", dnsmgr_reload },
00235    { "extconfig", read_config_maps },
00236    { "enum",   ast_enum_reload },
00237    { "manager",   reload_manager },
00238    { "rtp", ast_rtp_reload },
00239    { "http",   ast_http_reload },
00240    { NULL,  NULL }
00241 };

00243 static int printdigest(const unsigned char *d)
00244 {
00245    int x, pos;
00246    char buf[256]; /* large enough so we don't have to worry */
00247 
00248    for (pos = 0, x = 0; x < 16; x++)
00249       pos += sprintf(buf + pos, " %02x", *d++);
00250 
00251    if (option_debug)
00252       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Unexpected signature:%s\n", buf);
00253 
00254    return 0;
00255 }
00256 
00257 static int key_matches(const unsigned char *key1, const unsigned char *key2)
00258 {
00259    int x;
00260 
00261    for (x = 0; x < 16; x++) {
00262       if (key1[x] != key2[x])
00263          return 0;
00264    }
00265 
00266    return 1;
00267 }
00268 
00269 static int verify_key(const unsigned char *key)
00270 {
00271    struct MD5Context c;
00272    unsigned char digest[16];
00273 
00274    MD5Init(&c);
00275    MD5Update(&c, key, strlen((char *)key));
00276    MD5Final(digest, &c);
00277 
00278    if (key_matches(expected_key, digest))
00279       return 0;
00280 
00281    printdigest(digest);
00282 
00283    return -1;
00284 }
00285 
00286 static int resource_name_match(const char *name1_in, const char *name2_in)
00287 {
00288    char *name1 = (char *) name1_in;
00289    char *name2 = (char *) name2_in;
00290 
00291    /* trim off any .so extensions */
00292    if (!strcasecmp(name1 + strlen(name1) - 3, ".so")) {
00293       name1 = ast_strdupa(name1);
00294       name1[strlen(name1) - 3] = '\0';
00295    }
00296    if (!strcasecmp(name2 + strlen(name2) - 3, ".so")) {
00297       name2 = ast_strdupa(name2);
00298       name2[strlen(name2) - 3] = '\0';
00299    }
00300 
00301    return strcasecmp(name1, name2);
00302 }
00303 
00304 static struct ast_module *find_resource(const char *resource, int do_lock)
00305 {
00306    struct ast_module *cur;
00307 
00308    if (do_lock)
00309       AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00310 
00311    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&module_list, cur, entry) {
00312       if (!resource_name_match(resource, cur->resource))
00313          break;
00314    }
00315 
00316    if (do_lock)
00317       AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00318 
00319    return cur;
00320 }
00321 
00322 #if LOADABLE_MODULES
00323 static void unload_dynamic_module(struct ast_module *mod)
00324 {
00325    void *lib = mod->lib;
00326 
00327    /* WARNING: the structure pointed to by mod is going to
00328       disappear when this operation succeeds, so we can't
00329       dereference it */
00330 
00331    if (lib)
00332       while (!dlclose(lib));
00333 }
00334 
00335 static struct ast_module *load_dynamic_module(const char *resource_in, unsigned int global_symbols_only)
00336 {
00337    char fn[256] = "";
00338    void *lib = NULL;
00339    struct ast_module *mod;
00340    char *resource = (char *) resource_in;
00341    unsigned int wants_global;
00342 
00343    if (strcasecmp(resource + strlen(resource) - 3, ".so")) {
00344       resource = alloca(strlen(resource_in) + 3);
00345            strcpy(resource, resource_in);
00346       strcat(resource, ".so");
00347    }
00348 
00349    snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "%s/%s", ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR, resource);
00350 
00351    /* make a first load of the module in 'quiet' mode... don't try to resolve
00352       any symbols, and don't export any symbols. this will allow us to peek into
00353       the module's info block (if available) to see what flags it has set */
00354 
00355    if (!(resource_being_loaded = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*resource_being_loaded) + strlen(resource) + 1)))
00356       return NULL;
00357 
00358    strcpy(resource_being_loaded->resource, resource);
00359 
00360    if (!(lib = dlopen(fn, RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_LOCAL))) {
00361       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Error loading module '%s': %s\n", resource_in, dlerror());
00362       free(resource_being_loaded);
00363       return NULL;
00364    }
00365 
00366    /* the dlopen() succeeded, let's find out if the module
00367       registered itself */
00368    /* note that this will only work properly as long as
00369       ast_module_register() (which is called by the module's
00370       constructor) places the new module at the tail of the
00371       module_list
00372    */
00373    if (resource_being_loaded != (mod = AST_LIST_LAST(&module_list))) {
00374       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' did not register itself during load\n", resource_in);
00375       /* no, it did not, so close it and return */
00376       while (!dlclose(lib));
00377       /* note that the module's destructor will call ast_module_unregister(),
00378          which will free the structure we allocated in resource_being_loaded */
00379       return NULL;
00380    }
00381 
00382    wants_global = ast_test_flag(mod->info, AST_MODFLAG_GLOBAL_SYMBOLS);
00383 
00384    /* if we are being asked only to load modules that provide global symbols,
00385       and this one does not, then close it and return */
00386    if (global_symbols_only && !wants_global) {
00387       while (!dlclose(lib));
00388       return NULL;
00389    }
00390 
00391    /* if the system supports RTLD_NOLOAD, we can just 'promote' the flags
00392       on the already-opened library to what we want... if not, we have to
00393       close it and start over
00394    */
00395 #if defined(HAVE_RTLD_NOLOAD) && !defined(__Darwin__)
00396    if (!dlopen(fn, RTLD_NOLOAD | (wants_global ? RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_GLOBAL : RTLD_NOW | RTLD_LOCAL))) {
00397       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to promote flags on module '%s': %s\n", resource_in, dlerror());
00398       while (!dlclose(lib));
00399       free(resource_being_loaded);
00400       return NULL;
00401    }
00402 #else
00403    while (!dlclose(lib));
00404    resource_being_loaded = NULL;
00405 
00406    /* start the load process again */
00407 
00408    if (!(resource_being_loaded = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*resource_being_loaded) + strlen(resource) + 1)))
00409       return NULL;
00410 
00411    strcpy(resource_being_loaded->resource, resource);
00412 
00413    if (!(lib = dlopen(fn, wants_global ? RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_GLOBAL : RTLD_NOW | RTLD_LOCAL))) {
00414       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Error loading module '%s': %s\n", resource_in, dlerror());
00415       free(resource_being_loaded);
00416       return NULL;
00417    }
00418 
00419    /* since the module was successfully opened, and it registered itself
00420       the previous time we did that, we're going to assume it worked this
00421       time too :) */
00422 #endif
00423 
00424    AST_LIST_LAST(&module_list)->lib = lib;
00425    resource_being_loaded = NULL;
00426 
00427    return AST_LIST_LAST(&module_list);
00428 }
00429 #endif
00430 
00431 int ast_unload_resource(const char *resource_name, enum ast_module_unload_mode force)
00432 {
00433    struct ast_module *mod;
00434    int res = -1;
00435    int error = 0;
00436 
00437    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00438 
00439    if (!(mod = find_resource(resource_name, 0))) {
00440       AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00441       return 0;
00442    }
00443 
00444    if (!(mod->flags.running || mod->flags.declined))
00445       error = 1;
00446 
00447    if (!error && (mod->usecount > 0)) {
00448       if (force)
00449          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Warning:  Forcing removal of module '%s' with use count %d\n",
00450             resource_name, mod->usecount);
00451       else {
00452          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Soft unload failed, '%s' has use count %d\n", resource_name,
00453             mod->usecount);
00454          error = 1;
00455       }
00456    }
00457 
00458    if (!error) {
00459       __ast_module_user_hangup_all(mod);
00460       res = mod->info->unload();
00461 
00462       if (res) {
00463          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Firm unload failed for %s\n", resource_name);
00464          if (force <= AST_FORCE_FIRM)
00465             error = 1;
00466          else
00467             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "** Dangerous **: Unloading resource anyway, at user request\n");
00468       }
00469    }
00470 
00471    if (!error)
00472       mod->flags.running = mod->flags.declined = 0;
00473 
00474    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00475 
00476    if (!error && !mod->lib)
00477       mod->info->restore_globals();
00478 
00479 #if LOADABLE_MODULES
00480    if (!error)
00481       unload_dynamic_module(mod);
00482 #endif
00483 
00484    if (!error)
00485       ast_update_use_count();
00486 
00487    return res;
00488 }
00489 
00490 char *ast_module_helper(const char *line, const char *word, int pos, int state, int rpos, int needsreload)
00491 {
00492    struct ast_module *cur;
00493    int i, which=0, l = strlen(word);
00494    char *ret = NULL;
00495 
00496    if (pos != rpos)
00497       return NULL;
00498 
00499    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00500    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&module_list, cur, entry) {
00501       if (!strncasecmp(word, cur->resource, l) &&
00502           (cur->info->reload || !needsreload) &&
00503           ++which > state) {
00504          ret = strdup(cur->resource);
00505          break;
00506       }
00507    }
00508    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00509 
00510    if (!ret) {
00511       for (i=0; !ret && reload_classes[i].name; i++) {
00512          if (!strncasecmp(word, reload_classes[i].name, l) && ++which > state)
00513             ret = strdup(reload_classes[i].name);
00514       }
00515    }
00516 
00517    return ret;
00518 }
00519 
00520 int ast_module_reload(const char *name)
00521 {
00522    struct ast_module *cur;
00523    int res = 0; /* return value. 0 = not found, others, see below */
00524    int i;
00525 
00526    if (ast_mutex_trylock(&reloadlock)) {
00527       ast_verbose("The previous reload command didn't finish yet\n");
00528       return -1;  /* reload already in progress */
00529    }
00530    ast_lastreloadtime = time(NULL);
00531 
00532    /* Call "predefined" reload here first */
00533    for (i = 0; reload_classes[i].name; i++) {
00534       if (!name || !strcasecmp(name, reload_classes[i].name)) {
00535          reload_classes[i].reload_fn();   /* XXX should check error ? */
00536          res = 2; /* found and reloaded */
00537       }
00538    }
00539 
00540    if (name && res) {
00541       ast_mutex_unlock(&reloadlock);
00542       return res;
00543    }
00544 
00545    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00546    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&module_list, cur, entry) {
00547       const struct ast_module_info *info = cur->info;
00548 
00549       if (name && resource_name_match(name, cur->resource))
00550          continue;
00551 
00552       if (!(cur->flags.running || cur->flags.declined))
00553          continue;
00554 
00555       if (!info->reload) { /* cannot be reloaded */
00556          if (res < 1)   /* store result if possible */
00557             res = 1; /* 1 = no reload() method */
00558          continue;
00559       }
00560 
00561       res = 2;
00562       if (option_verbose > 2)
00563          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Reloading module '%s' (%s)\n", cur->resource, info->description);
00564       info->reload();
00565    }
00566    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00567 
00568    ast_mutex_unlock(&reloadlock);
00569 
00570    return res;
00571 }
00572 
00573 static unsigned int inspect_module(const struct ast_module *mod)
00574 {
00575    if (!mod->info->description) {
00576       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' does not provide a description.\n", mod->resource);
00577       return 1;
00578    }
00579 
00580    if (!mod->info->key) {
00581       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' does not provide a license key.\n", mod->resource);
00582       return 1;
00583    }
00584 
00585    if (verify_key((unsigned char *) mod->info->key)) {
00586       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' did not provide a valid license key.\n", mod->resource);
00587       return 1;
00588    }
00589 
00590    return 0;
00591 }
00592 
00593 static enum ast_module_load_result load_resource(const char *resource_name, unsigned int global_symbols_only)
00594 {
00595    struct ast_module *mod;
00596    enum ast_module_load_result res = AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS;
00597    char tmp[256];
00598 
00599    if ((mod = find_resource(resource_name, 0))) {
00600       if (mod->flags.running) {
00601          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' already exists.\n", resource_name);
00602          return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
00603       }
00604       if (global_symbols_only && !ast_test_flag(mod->info, AST_MODFLAG_GLOBAL_SYMBOLS))
00605          return AST_MODULE_LOAD_SKIP;
00606    } else {
00607 #if LOADABLE_MODULES
00608       if (!(mod = load_dynamic_module(resource_name, global_symbols_only))) {
00609          /* don't generate a warning message during load_modules() */
00610          if (!global_symbols_only) {
00611             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' could not be loaded.\n", resource_name);
00612             return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
00613          } else {
00614             return AST_MODULE_LOAD_SKIP;
00615          }
00616       }
00617 #else
00618       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' could not be loaded.\n", resource_name);
00619       return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
00620 #endif
00621    }
00622 
00623    if (inspect_module(mod)) {
00624       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' could not be loaded.\n", resource_name);
00625 #if LOADABLE_MODULES
00626       unload_dynamic_module(mod);
00627 #endif
00628       return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
00629    }
00630 
00631    if (!mod->lib && mod->info->backup_globals()) {
00632       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Module '%s' was unable to backup its global data.\n", resource_name);
00633       return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
00634    }
00635 
00636    mod->flags.declined = 0;
00637 
00638    if (mod->info->load)
00639       res = mod->info->load();
00640 
00641    switch (res) {
00642    case AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS:
00643       if (!ast_fully_booted) {
00644          if (option_verbose)
00645             ast_verbose("%s => (%s)\n", resource_name, term_color(tmp, mod->info->description, COLOR_BROWN, COLOR_BLACK, sizeof(tmp)));
00646          if (ast_opt_console && !option_verbose)
00647             ast_verbose( ".");
00648       } else {
00649          if (option_verbose)
00650             ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_1 "Loaded %s => (%s)\n", resource_name, mod->info->description);
00651       }
00652 
00653       mod->flags.running = 1;
00654 
00655       ast_update_use_count();
00656       break;
00657    case AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE:
00658       mod->flags.declined = 1;
00659       break;
00660    case AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE:
00661       break;
00662    case AST_MODULE_LOAD_SKIP:
00663       /* modules should never return this value */
00664       break;
00665    }
00666 
00667    return res;
00668 }
00669 
00670 int ast_load_resource(const char *resource_name)
00671 {
00672        AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00673        load_resource(resource_name, 0);
00674        AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00675 
00676        return 0;
00677 }
00678 
00679 struct load_order_entry {
00680    char *resource;
00681    AST_LIST_ENTRY(load_order_entry) entry;
00682 };
00683 
00684 AST_LIST_HEAD_NOLOCK(load_order, load_order_entry);
00685 
00686 static struct load_order_entry *add_to_load_order(const char *resource, struct load_order *load_order)
00687 {
00688    struct load_order_entry *order;
00689 
00690    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(load_order, order, entry) {
00691       if (!resource_name_match(order->resource, resource))
00692          return NULL;
00693    }
00694 
00695    if (!(order = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*order))))
00696       return NULL;
00697 
00698    order->resource = ast_strdup(resource);
00699    AST_LIST_INSERT_TAIL(load_order, order, entry);
00700 
00701    return order;
00702 }
00703 
00704 int load_modules(unsigned int preload_only)
00705 {
00706    struct ast_config *cfg;
00707    struct ast_module *mod;
00708    struct load_order_entry *order;
00709    struct ast_variable *v;
00710    unsigned int load_count;
00711    struct load_order load_order;
00712    int res = 0;
00713 #if LOADABLE_MODULES
00714    struct dirent *dirent;
00715    DIR *dir;
00716 #endif
00717 
00718    /* all embedded modules have registered themselves by now */
00719    embedding = 0;
00720 
00721    if (option_verbose)
00722       ast_verbose("Asterisk Dynamic Loader Starting:\n");
00723 
00724    AST_LIST_HEAD_INIT_NOLOCK(&load_order);
00725 
00726    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00727 
00728    if (!(cfg = ast_config_load(AST_MODULE_CONFIG))) {
00729       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No '%s' found, no modules will be loaded.\n", AST_MODULE_CONFIG);
00730       goto done;
00731    }
00732 
00733    /* first, find all the modules we have been explicitly requested to load */
00734    for (v = ast_variable_browse(cfg, "modules"); v; v = v->next) {
00735       if (!strcasecmp(v->name, preload_only ? "preload" : "load"))
00736          add_to_load_order(v->value, &load_order);
00737    }
00738 
00739    /* check if 'autoload' is on */
00740    if (!preload_only && ast_true(ast_variable_retrieve(cfg, "modules", "autoload"))) {
00741       /* if so, first add all the embedded modules that are not already running to the load order */
00742       AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&module_list, mod, entry) {
00743          /* if it's not embedded, skip it */
00744          if (mod->lib)
00745             continue;
00746 
00747          if (mod->flags.running)
00748             continue;
00749 
00750          order = add_to_load_order(mod->resource, &load_order);
00751       }
00752 
00753 #if LOADABLE_MODULES
00754       /* if we are allowed to load dynamic modules, scan the directory for
00755          for all available modules and add them as well */
00756       if ((dir  = opendir(ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR))) {
00757          while ((dirent = readdir(dir))) {
00758             int ld = strlen(dirent->d_name);
00759 
00760             /* Must end in .so to load it.  */
00761 
00762             if (ld < 4)
00763                continue;
00764 
00765             if (strcasecmp(dirent->d_name + ld - 3, ".so"))
00766                continue;
00767 
00768             /* if there is already a module by this name in the module_list,
00769                skip this file */
00770             if (find_resource(dirent->d_name, 0))
00771                continue;
00772 
00773             add_to_load_order(dirent->d_name, &load_order);
00774          }
00775 
00776          closedir(dir);
00777       } else {
00778          if (!ast_opt_quiet)
00779             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open modules directory '%s'.\n",
00780                ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR);
00781       }
00782 #endif
00783    }
00784 
00785    /* now scan the config for any modules we are prohibited from loading and
00786       remove them from the load order */
00787    for (v = ast_variable_browse(cfg, "modules"); v; v = v->next) {
00788       if (strcasecmp(v->name, "noload"))
00789          continue;
00790 
00791       AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&load_order, order, entry) {
00792          if (!resource_name_match(order->resource, v->value)) {
00793             AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&load_order, entry);
00794             free(order->resource);
00795             free(order);
00796          }
00797       }
00798       AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00799    }
00800 
00801    /* we are done with the config now, all the information we need is in the
00802       load_order list */
00803    ast_config_destroy(cfg);
00804 
00805    load_count = 0;
00806    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&load_order, order, entry)
00807       load_count++;
00808 
00809    if (load_count)
00810       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "%d modules will be loaded.\n", load_count);
00811 
00812    /* first, load only modules that provide global symbols */
00813    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&load_order, order, entry) {
00814       switch (load_resource(order->resource, 1)) {
00815       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS:
00816       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE:
00817          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&load_order, entry);
00818          free(order->resource);
00819          free(order);
00820          break;
00821       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE:
00822          res = -1;
00823          goto done;
00824       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_SKIP:
00825          /* try again later */
00826          break;
00827       }
00828    }
00829    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00830 
00831    /* now load everything else */
00832    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&load_order, order, entry) {
00833       switch (load_resource(order->resource, 0)) {
00834       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS:
00835       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE:
00836          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&load_order, entry);
00837          free(order->resource);
00838          free(order);
00839          break;
00840       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE:
00841          res = -1;
00842          goto done;
00843       case AST_MODULE_LOAD_SKIP:
00844          /* should not happen */
00845          break;
00846       }
00847    }
00848    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00849 
00850 done:
00851    while ((order = AST_LIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&load_order, entry))) {
00852       free(order->resource);
00853       free(order);
00854    }
00855 
00856    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00857 
00858    return res;
00859 }
00860 
00861 void ast_update_use_count(void)
00862 {
00863    /* Notify any module monitors that the use count for a
00864       resource has changed */
00865    struct loadupdate *m;
00866 
00867    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00868    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&updaters, m, entry)
00869       m->updater();
00870    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00871 }
00872 
00873 int ast_update_module_list(int (*modentry)(const char *module, const char *description, int usecnt, const char *like),
00874             const char *like)
00875 {
00876    struct ast_module *cur;
00877    int unlock = -1;
00878    int total_mod_loaded = 0;
00879 
00880    if (AST_LIST_TRYLOCK(&module_list))
00881       unlock = 0;
00882 
00883    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&module_list, cur, entry) {
00884       total_mod_loaded += modentry(cur->resource, cur->info->description, cur->usecount, like);
00885    }
00886 
00887    if (unlock)
00888       AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00889 
00890    return total_mod_loaded;
00891 }
00892 
00893 /*! \brief Check if module exists */
00894 int ast_module_check(const char *name)
00895 {
00896    struct ast_module *cur;
00897 
00898    if (ast_strlen_zero(name))
00899       return 0;       /* FALSE */
00900 
00901    cur = find_resource(name, 1);
00902 
00903    return (cur != NULL);
00904 }
00905 
00906 
00907 int ast_loader_register(int (*v)(void))
00908 {
00909    struct loadupdate *tmp;
00910 
00911    if (!(tmp = ast_malloc(sizeof(*tmp))))
00912       return -1;
00913 
00914    tmp->updater = v;
00915    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00916    AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&updaters, tmp, entry);
00917    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00918 
00919    return 0;
00920 }
00921 
00922 int ast_loader_unregister(int (*v)(void))
00923 {
00924    struct loadupdate *cur;
00925 
00926    AST_LIST_LOCK(&module_list);
00927    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&updaters, cur, entry) {
00928       if (cur->updater == v)  {
00929          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&updaters, entry);
00930          break;
00931       }
00932    }
00933    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00934    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&module_list);
00935 
00936    return cur ? 0 : -1;
00937 }
00938 
00939 struct ast_module *ast_module_ref(struct ast_module *mod)
00940 {
00941    ast_atomic_fetchadd_int(&mod->usecount, +1);
00942    ast_update_use_count();
00943 
00944    return mod;
00945 }
00946 
00947 void ast_module_unref(struct ast_module *mod)
00948 {
00949    ast_atomic_fetchadd_int(&mod->usecount, -1);
00950    ast_update_use_count();
00951 }
